original: 19 出納求利學處出納求利學處第十九爾時薄伽梵在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園，遠近皆聞中國有佛出現於世，彼諸聲聞弟子有大神通作諸變化，廣說如上，若有人能於彼弟子作供養者，得大果報饒益增廣。
analyzed: 19 出納求利學處出納求利學處第十九爾時薄伽梵在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園，遠近皆聞中國有佛出現於世，彼諸聲聞弟子有大神通作諸變化，廣說如上，若有人能於彼弟子作供養者，得大果報饒益增廣。
translated: The chapter on lending and seeking profit, the nineteenth chapter on lending and seeking profit. At that time, the Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's Park. Far and near all heard that in the central country there was a Buddha who appeared in the world, and that his disciples had great spiritual powers and performed various transformations, as explained in detail above. If there were people who could make offerings to those disciples, they would obtain great rewards and their benefits would increase and spread.

original: 是時北方有諸商客，聞此聲譽自相謂曰：
analyzed: 是時北方有諸商客，聞此聲譽自相謂曰：
translated: At that time, there were merchants from the north who heard this reputation and said to each other:
Gentlemen, you should know!

original: 我等宜往中國興易，一則多得利潤，二乃供養三寶。
analyzed: 我等宜往中國興易，一則多得利潤，二乃供養三寶。
translated: We should go to the central country to do business. First, we will make a lot of profit, and second, we will make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: 」時諸商人遂即多賷北方貨物，往趣中國漸至室羅伐。
analyzed: 」時諸商人遂即多賷北方貨物，往趣中國漸至室羅伐。
translated: Then the merchants brought many goods from the north and went to the central country, gradually arriving in Śrāvastī.

original: 於此城中有一露形外道，善識天文妙閑算記，聞有商客從北方來，作如是念：
analyzed: 於此城中有一露形外道，善識天文妙閑算記，聞有商客從北方來，作如是念：
translated: In this city there was a naked ascetic who was well-versed in astronomy and proficient in divination. Hearing that merchants were coming from the north, he thought:

original: 「我今試往觀問商人，或容於彼少有所獲。
analyzed: 「我今試往觀問商人，或容於彼少有所獲。
translated: I will now try to go and ask the merchants, perhaps I may obtain something from them.

original: 」即取相書占察前事，觀知商主父母名字及所持貨得利多少，便詣商主所，告言：🔽「善來！
analyzed: 」即取相書占察前事，觀知商主父母名字及所持貨得利多少，便詣商主所，告言： 「善來！
translated: He then took up divination and examined the matter, and knew the names of the merchant leader's parents and the amount of profit he would make on the goods he was carrying. He then went to the merchant leader and said:🔽Welcome!
Welcome!

original: 某甲商主，汝父名某甲母名某甲，將如是貨來詣此方，某日得爾許利。
analyzed: 某甲商主，汝父名某甲母名某甲，將如是貨來詣此方，某日得爾許利。
translated: Merchant leader so-and-so, your father's name is so-and-so and your mother's name is so-and-so. You are bringing such goods to this place, and on such a day you will make so much profit.
When the merchant leader heard this, he thought:

original: 「我比曾聞世尊弟子，大有神變騰煙注雨，此即其人。
analyzed: 「我比曾聞世尊弟子，大有神變騰煙注雨，此即其人。
translated: I have heard that the disciples of the World-Honored One have great spiritual powers, manifesting smoke and pouring rain. This must be one of them.

original: 」商主既生敬信，便以北方朱色毛緂并北方奇果，盛滿器中手自持奉。
analyzed: 」商主既生敬信，便以北方朱色毛緂并北方奇果，盛滿器中手自持奉。
translated: The caravan leader, having given rise to reverence and faith, then offered with his own hands a northern red woolen blanket and a vessel filled with exotic fruits from the north.

original: 彼既得已，即便披緂往同徒處。
analyzed: 彼既得已，即便披緂往同徒處。
translated: After he received them, he put on the blanket and went to his fellow practitioners.
His companions, upon seeing him, asked:

original: 「汝於何處得此貴價上好物來？
analyzed: 「汝於何處得此貴價上好物來？
translated: Where did you get this valuable, high-quality item?
He replied:

original: 「北方商客我往看之，為說父母名字，彼心信敬見惠於我。
analyzed: 「北方商客我往看之，為說父母名字，彼心信敬見惠於我。
translated: I went to see the northern merchants and told them my parents' names. They had faith and respect and gave it to me.
His companions said:
Sir!

original: 我等常被沙門釋子之所輕蔑，每告我曰：
analyzed: 我等常被沙門釋子之所輕蔑，每告我曰：
translated: We are always looked down upon by the Śramaṇas, the disciples of Śākyamuni. They always tell us:

original: 『汝等曾不親近貴勝好人，但唯狎習傭力賤品旃荼羅類。
analyzed: 『汝等曾不親近貴勝好人，但唯狎習傭力賤品旃荼羅類。
translated: 'You have never associated with noble and excellent people, but only befriend lowly, menial, and untouchable types.'

original: 』仁今宜可披此貴服，往詣沙門釋子之處刺彼心胸。
analyzed: 』仁今宜可披此貴服，往詣沙門釋子之處刺彼心胸。
translated: You should now put on this valuable garment and go to the place of the Śramaṇa disciples of Śākyamuni to pierce their hearts.
He replied:
So be it.

original: 」時露形外道即披毛緂往逝多林。
analyzed: 」時露形外道即披毛緂往逝多林。
translated: At that time, the naked ascetic put on the woolen cloak and went to Jetavana.

original: 時鄔波難陀於逝多林門經行遊適，遙見彼來便作是念：
analyzed: 時鄔波難陀於逝多林門經行遊適，遙見彼來便作是念：
translated: At that time, Upananda was walking and strolling at the gate of Jetavana. Seeing him from afar, he thought:

original: 「外道披者是好貴物，我若不能得此物者，不復更名鄔波難陀矣。
analyzed: 「外道披者是好貴物，我若不能得此物者，不復更名鄔波難陀矣。
translated: The cloak worn by the ascetic is a good and valuable item. If I cannot obtain this item, I will no longer be called Upananda.
As they gradually approached, he asked:
Ascetic!
Are you now returning to lay life?
He replied:
I am not returning to lay life.
If that is so, why are you wearing this robe?
He replied:

original: 「北方商客，我為說彼眷屬名字，既懷敬重用此相施。
analyzed: 「北方商客，我為說彼眷屬名字，既懷敬重用此相施。
translated: Northern merchants, for whom I spoke the names of their relatives, out of respect and reverence used this to give to me.
Upananda said:🔽This is not a good thing!
This is not a good thing!

original: 豈容年邁衰朽為破戒耶？
analyzed: 豈容年邁衰朽為破戒耶？
translated: How can it be allowed for an old and decrepit one to break the precepts?
You should sit for a while and listen to the essentials of the Dharma.
At that time, the non-Buddhist followed his words and sat down.

original: 時鄔波難陀以歡喜心為其說法，若鄔波難陀為他宣說捨施法時，彼婆羅門諸居士等，皆欲割自身肉持以相施。
analyzed: 時鄔波難陀以歡喜心為其說法，若鄔波難陀為他宣說捨施法時，彼婆羅門諸居士等，皆欲割自身肉持以相施。
translated: At that time, Upananda, with a joyful mind, expounded the Dharma for him. When Upananda expounded the Dharma of giving up and giving away to others, those brahmins and householders all wanted to cut off their own flesh and give it to him.

original: 鄔波難陀因說法次而告之曰：
analyzed: 鄔波難陀因說法次而告之曰：
translated: Because of expounding the Dharma, Upananda said to him:
Non-Buddhist!

original: 汝之大師性愛麁弊，教汝門徒露形拔髮、多行少住、常臥于地。
analyzed: 汝之大師性愛麁弊，教汝門徒露形拔髮、多行少住、常臥于地。
translated: Your teacher is by nature fond of coarseness and simplicity, teaching your disciples to go naked, pull out their hair, do much walking and little sitting, and always lie on the ground.

original: 若汝大師情所愛樂好衣食者，當許汝著價直千萬上妙之衣，百味飲食隨意餐噉，所住房舍價當五千。
analyzed: 若汝大師情所愛樂好衣食者，當許汝著價直千萬上妙之衣，百味飲食隨意餐噉，所住房舍價當五千。
translated: If your teacher is fond of good clothes and food, he should allow you to wear the best clothes worth millions, eat a hundred flavors of food as you wish, and live in a house worth five thousand.
But because of his narrow mind, he does not allow it.

original: 我之大師情懷廣大，許我弟子著萬價衣餐百味食，所居房舍數直五千。
analyzed: 我之大師情懷廣大，許我弟子著萬價衣餐百味食，所居房舍數直五千。
translated: My teacher has a magnanimous mind and allows my disciples to wear clothes worth ten thousand, eat a hundred flavors of food, and live in a house worth five thousand.

original: 若汝披此貴價好服行乞食者，信敬之人作如是念：
analyzed: 若汝披此貴價好服行乞食者，信敬之人作如是念：
translated: If you go begging for food wearing this expensive and fine robe, people who have faith and respect will think:
'This non-Buddhist practitioner's bodily actions violate the precepts.
It will be difficult to provide food and drink for him.'

original: 汝此上衣宜應與我，我有毛緂持以相換，我當披著巡家乞食。
analyzed: 汝此上衣宜應與我，我有毛緂持以相換，我當披著巡家乞食。
translated: You should give me this upper robe of yours. I have a woolen blanket that I will give to you in exchange. I will wear it when going from house to house begging for food.
If a person with pure faith comes and asks me:
'Venerable one, where did you obtain this upper robe?'
I will answer him:

original: 『有露形人，姓名某甲，輟已相施。
analyzed: 『有露形人，姓名某甲，輟已相施。
translated: 'There is a naked ascetic named so-and-so who gave it to me.'
He will then know that you are a deeply faithful person.

original: 汝乞食時彼若見者，當以酒糟盛滿銅器供養於汝。
analyzed: 汝乞食時彼若見者，當以酒糟盛滿銅器供養於汝。
translated: When you are begging for food and he sees you, he will fill a copper vessel with brewer's grains and offer it to you.

original: 」時彼露形聞是語已便生信喜，作如是言：
analyzed: 」時彼露形聞是語已便生信喜，作如是言：
translated: When the naked ascetic heard these words, he became joyful with faith and said:
Venerable Upananda!
If it is like this, then take this robe.
Upananda then gave a blessing, saying:
May you be free from illness and live long!

original: 然汝徒黨貧苦是常，聞汝施時還令相奪。
analyzed: 然汝徒黨貧苦是常，聞汝施時還令相奪。
translated: However, your followers are always poor. When they hear you give, they will take it back.
They said:
Venerable!
Is this woolen cloak theirs?
It is my own, please don't worry.
Upananda said:
If that's the case, I will accept it for you.

original: 」既受得已，即便與一麁鞕毛緂。
analyzed: 」既受得已，即便與一麁鞕毛緂。
translated: After receiving it, he immediately gave him a coarse woolen cloak.

original: 時彼外道披之而去，至同梵行邊。
analyzed: 時彼外道披之而去，至同梵行邊。
translated: The non-Buddhist then put it on and left, going to his fellow practitioners.
They asked him:
Where did you get this robe?
He replied to them:
Someone exchanged it with me.
They asked:
Who is it?
He answered:
The Venerable Upananda exchanged it with me.
When they heard this, they all became angry and said:

original: 「仁者，此之釋子常思殺我，餘雖見欺不同六眾，六人之內無越鄔波難陀。
analyzed: 「仁者，此之釋子常思殺我，餘雖見欺不同六眾，六人之內無越鄔波難陀。
translated: Venerable one, this Śākya son always thinks of killing me. Although the others deceive me, they are not the same as the group of six. Among the six, there is none worse than Upananda.

original: 仁若施與餘大德者我亦隨喜，而鄔波難陀欲飲我血，將衣施彼誰堪忍耶？
analyzed: 仁若施與餘大德者我亦隨喜，而鄔波難陀欲飲我血，將衣施彼誰堪忍耶？
translated: If you give it to another great virtuous one, I will also rejoice. But Upananda wants to drink my blood. Who can bear it if I give the robe to him?
You should go and ask for it.

original: 若得者善，若不得者，我同擯汝，移汝坐處，覆汝食器，不相共語。
analyzed: 若得者善，若不得者，我同擯汝，移汝坐處，覆汝食器，不相共語。
translated: If you get it, it's good. If you don't get it, we will expel you together, move your seat, cover your eating bowl, and not speak to you.
He then became afraid and went to Upananda.

original: 鄔波難陀既遙見來，即作是念：
analyzed: 鄔波難陀既遙見來，即作是念：
translated: When Upananda saw him coming from afar, he thought:

original: 「看此外道舉動形勢，必當奪我上好毛緂。
analyzed: 「看此外道舉動形勢，必當奪我上好毛緂。
translated: Judging by this heretic's movements and demeanor, he will certainly take away my best woolen blanket.
He quickly entered his room, closed the door, and stayed there.

original: 外道既至扣門相喚，鄔波難陀默然不對，諸苾芻見問言：
analyzed: 外道既至扣門相喚，鄔波難陀默然不對，諸苾芻見問言：
translated: When the heretic arrived, he knocked on the door and called out. Upananda remained silent and did not respond. The bhikṣus saw this and asked:
Heretic!
Why do you need to see Upananda?
He replied:
I came to look for him because he took my woolen cloak.
The bhikṣus said:

original: 「汝若欲得舊毛緂者，往世尊所求哀歸向。
analyzed: 「汝若欲得舊毛緂者，往世尊所求哀歸向。
translated: If you want to get back your old woolen cloak, go to the World-Honored One and seek his compassion and return.
Then the non-Buddhist went to where the Buddha was.

original: 爾時世尊遙見外道來，告諸苾芻曰：
analyzed: 爾時世尊遙見外道來，告諸苾芻曰：
translated: At that time, the World-Honored One saw from afar the non-Buddhist coming and told the bhikṣus:
Do you see that non-Buddhist coming?
They said to the Buddha:
We see him.
The Buddha said:
He comes for the sake of the woolen cloak.

original: 若索得者善，若不得者便歐熱血而致命終。
analyzed: 若索得者善，若不得者便歐熱血而致命終。
translated: If he gets it back, it will be good. If he does not get it, he will spit hot blood and die.
The non-Buddhist came to where the Buddha was and said this:

original: 「大德鄔波難陀取我毛緂，唯願世尊慈悲哀愍令彼還我。
analyzed: 「大德鄔波難陀取我毛緂，唯願世尊慈悲哀愍令彼還我。
translated: Venerable Upananda took my woolen cloak. May the World-Honored One, out of compassion and pity, order him to return it to me.

original: 若不還者，我等同梵行者擯斥於我。
analyzed: 若不還者，我等同梵行者擯斥於我。
translated: If he does not return it, my fellow practitioners will expel me.
As before, he explained in detail.🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: 爾時世尊告具壽阿難陀曰：
analyzed: 爾時世尊告具壽阿難陀曰：
translated: At that time the World-Honored One told the Venerable Ānanda:
You go yourself and tell Upāli:
'May you be well.
' And tell him:
'You should return that non-Buddhist's woolen cloak.

original: 若不還者，此之外道當歐熱血而取命終。
analyzed: 若不還者，此之外道當歐熱血而取命終。
translated: If you do not return it, that non-Buddhist will spit hot blood and die.'

original: 』」時具壽阿難陀奉佛教已往鄔波難陀所，時彼遙見作如是念：
analyzed: 』」時具壽阿難陀奉佛教已往鄔波難陀所，時彼遙見作如是念：
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, having received the Buddha's instruction, went to where Upāli was. When he saw him from afar, he thought like this:

original: 「看此外道將佛侍者以為使人，必當見奪我之毛緂。
analyzed: 「看此外道將佛侍者以為使人，必當見奪我之毛緂。
translated: Look at this non-Buddhist, taking the Buddha's attendant as a messenger. He will certainly take away my woolen cloak.

original: 」時具壽阿難陀報鄔波難陀曰：
analyzed: 」時具壽阿難陀報鄔波難陀曰：
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said to Upāli:
Venerable!
The World-Honored One wishes you well.

original: 」鄔波難陀聞是語已即從座起，報言：
analyzed: 」鄔波難陀聞是語已即從座起，報言：
translated: When Upāli heard these words, he immediately got up from his seat and said:
I now pay homage to the unsurpassed World-Honored One.
Ānanda said:🔽You should return that non-Buddhist's woolen cloak.

original: 「世尊有教，宜當見還外道毛緂。
analyzed: 「世尊有教，宜當見還外道毛緂。
translated: The World-Honored One has instructed that you should return the non-Buddhist's woolen cloak.
If you can return it, that would be excellent.

original: 若不還者，此之外道當歐熱血而取命終。
analyzed: 若不還者，此之外道當歐熱血而取命終。
translated: If you do not return it, this non-Buddhist will spit hot blood and die.
Upananda said:
I respectfully follow the Buddha's teachings, how could I dare disobey?

original: 若非佛教遣我還者，汝令外道滿贍部洲數如竹葦甘蔗，皆歐熱血一時命終，我鄔波難陀一毛不動。
analyzed: 若非佛教遣我還者，汝令外道滿贍部洲數如竹葦甘蔗，皆歐熱血一時命終，我鄔波難陀一毛不動。
translated: If it were not the Buddha's instruction to send me back, even if you had non-Buddhists filling Jambudvīpa as numerous as bamboo, reeds, and sugar cane, all spitting hot blood and dying at the same time, not a single hair on me, Upananda, would move.

original: 具壽阿難陀可去，我當還彼。
analyzed: 具壽阿難陀可去，我當還彼。
translated: Venerable Ānanda can go, I will return it to him.
He then said to the non-Buddhist:

original: 「汝之大師先行妄語欺誑世間，彼命終已墮在無間大地獄中，在彼舌上有五百犁晝夜耕墾。
analyzed: 「汝之大師先行妄語欺誑世間，彼命終已墮在無間大地獄中，在彼舌上有五百犁晝夜耕墾。
translated: Your teacher first spoke falsely, deceiving the world. After his death, he fell into the Avīci great hell, where there are five hundred plows plowing his tongue day and night.

original: 汝今妄語更倍於彼，當有千犁常耕汝舌。
analyzed: 汝今妄語更倍於彼，當有千犁常耕汝舌。
translated: Your false speech is now twice as much as his, and there will always be a thousand plows plowing your tongue.
Upananda said:

original: 「汝已著我毛緂，汝物我曾不用。
analyzed: 「汝已著我毛緂，汝物我曾不用。
translated: You already put on my woolen cloak, and I never used your things.
The non-Buddhist replied:
I also did not put it on.

original: 」時鄔波難陀取彼毛緂解其結處，攝為四疊安左手中，右手摋拍遂令其緂悉皆碎破，報外道曰：
analyzed: 」時鄔波難陀取彼毛緂解其結處，攝為四疊安左手中，右手摋拍遂令其緂悉皆碎破，報外道曰：
translated: At that time, Upananda took the woolen cloak, untied it, folded it into four layers and placed it in his left hand, then slapped it with his right hand, causing the cloak to be completely torn to shreds. He said to the non-Buddhist:
Stretch out your two hands.

original: 」便以毛緂連頭總搭，遂便倒地便蹴其脇，語言：
analyzed: 」便以毛緂連頭總搭，遂便倒地便蹴其脇，語言：
translated: He then draped the woolen cloak over his head, causing him to fall to the ground. He kicked his side and said:
Non-Buddhist!🔽Go quickly!
Go quickly!
Don't let your filth defile my dwelling place.
The non-Buddhist replied:
Venerable!

original: 我今命存得出去者，更不敢入逝多園林。
analyzed: 我今命存得出去者，更不敢入逝多園林。
translated: If I can get out alive now, I dare not enter Jetavana Grove again.

original: 」此是緣起，然佛世尊尚未制戒。
analyzed: 」此是緣起，然佛世尊尚未制戒。
translated: This is the origin, but the World-Honored Buddha had not yet established the precepts.

original: 爾時六眾苾芻種種出息，或取、或與，或生、或質；
analyzed: 爾時六眾苾芻種種出息，或取、或與，或生、或質；
translated: At that time, the six groups of bhikṣus engaged in various transactions, either buying or selling, or borrowing or mortgaging;

original: 以成取成、以未成取成、以成取未成、以未成取未成。
analyzed: 以成取成、以未成取成、以成取未成、以未成取未成。
translated: Taking the finished product from the unfinished, taking the unfinished from the finished.

original: 言取者，謂即收取他方愛樂所有貨物載運將去，覓防守人立諸券契，是名為取。
analyzed: 言取者，謂即收取他方愛樂所有貨物載運將去，覓防守人立諸券契，是名為取。
translated: As for taking, it means to collect and take the goods that others love and carry them away, seeking guards and establishing contracts, this is called taking.

original: 言與者，謂與他物八日、十日等而立契證，是名為與。
analyzed: 言與者，謂與他物八日、十日等而立契證，是名為與。
translated: As for giving, it means to give things to others on the eighth, tenth, and other days and establish contracts, this is called giving.

original: 言生者，謂是生利與他少物多取穀麥，或加五、或一倍、二倍等，貯畜升斗立其券契，是名為生。
analyzed: 言生者，謂是生利與他少物多取穀麥，或加五、或一倍、二倍等，貯畜升斗立其券契，是名為生。
translated: As for interest, it means to give others a small amount of things and take back a large amount of grain and wheat, or add five, one, or two times, store bushels and pecks and establish contracts, this is called interest.

original: 言質者，謂取寶珠等同前立契，求好保證與其財物，是名為質。🔽言成取成者，謂以金銀等器取他成器。
analyzed: 言質者，謂取寶珠等同前立契，求好保證與其財物，是名為質。 言成取成者，謂以金銀等器取他成器。
translated: As for collateral, it means to take precious jewels and establish contracts as before, seek good guarantees and give them wealth, this is called collateral.🔽As for taking the finished product from the finished, it means to take other finished vessels with gold, silver, and other utensils.

original: 言未成取成者，謂以金鋌取他金器。
analyzed: 言未成取成者，謂以金鋌取他金器。
translated: As for taking the finished from the unfinished, it means to take other gold vessels with gold ingots.

original: 言成取未成者，謂以金器取他金鋌。
analyzed: 言成取未成者，謂以金器取他金鋌。
translated: As for using the finished to take the unfinished, it means using a gold vessel to take another's gold ingot.

original: 言以未成取未成者，謂以金鋌取他碎金。
analyzed: 言以未成取未成者，謂以金鋌取他碎金。
translated: As for using the unfinished to take the unfinished, it means using a gold ingot to take another's gold dust.

original: 苾芻如是交易以求其利，時諸外道見是事已皆生嫌賤：
analyzed: 苾芻如是交易以求其利，時諸外道見是事已皆生嫌賤：
translated: When the bhikṣus traded in this way to seek profit, the non-Buddhists saw this and all gave rise to disdain, saying:

original: 「云何沙門釋子出物求利，與俗何殊？
analyzed: 「云何沙門釋子出物求利，與俗何殊？
translated: How can the Śramaṇa Śākyaputras take out goods to seek profit? What is the difference from the laity?

original: 誰能與彼衣食而相供給？
analyzed: 誰能與彼衣食而相供給？
translated: Who can give them clothing and food to provide for them?

original: 」諸苾芻聞具以白佛，佛言廣說如上，乃至「制其學處，應如是說：
analyzed: 」諸苾芻聞具以白佛，佛言廣說如上，乃至「制其學處，應如是說：
translated: The bhikṣus heard this and reported it in detail to the Buddha. The Buddha said, explaining in detail as above, up to establishing the training rule, which should be said like this:

original: 「若復苾芻種種出納求利者，泥薩祇波逸底迦。
analyzed: 「若復苾芻種種出納求利者，泥薩祇波逸底迦。
translated: If a bhikṣu engages in various kinds of lending and borrowing to seek profit, it is a nissaggiya pācittiya offense.
As for bhikṣu, it refers to the group of six.
As for various, it means not just one thing.

original: 出納求利者，謂作取與生貪而覓利潤。
analyzed: 出納求利者，謂作取與生貪而覓利潤。
translated: Lending and borrowing to seek profit means making loans and borrowing to seek profit and gain.

original: 得捨墮罪者，作法廣說如上。
analyzed: 得捨墮罪者，作法廣說如上。
translated: As for attaining a nissaggiya pācittiya offense, the method of confession is explained in detail as above.🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: 此中犯相者，若苾芻為求利故，收聚貨物作諸方便，驅馳車乘往詣他方，立契保人持輸稅物，乃至未得利來但惡作罪，若得利時便招捨墮。
analyzed: 此中犯相者，若苾芻為求利故，收聚貨物作諸方便，驅馳車乘往詣他方，立契保人持輸稅物，乃至未得利來但惡作罪，若得利時便招捨墮。
translated: The rule here is that if a bhikṣu, for the sake of profit, collects goods and makes various arrangements, drives carts and goes to other places, establishes contracts and holds taxable goods, up to not yet obtaining profit, he only commits an offense of wrong conduct. If he obtains profit, he incurs the offense of pārājika.

original: 若苾芻為求利故，以諸財貨金銀等物，出與他人共立契保，乃至得罪如前廣說。
analyzed: 若苾芻為求利故，以諸財貨金銀等物，出與他人共立契保，乃至得罪如前廣說。
translated: If a bhikṣu, for the sake of seeking profit, takes out various goods such as gold, silver, etc., and gives them to others to establish contracts and guarantors, up to incurring offenses as explained in detail above.

original: 若苾芻為求生利，將諸財穀舉與他人，升斗校量共立契證，乃至得罪如前廣說。
analyzed: 若苾芻為求生利，將諸財穀舉與他人，升斗校量共立契證，乃至得罪如前廣說。
translated: If a bhikṣu, for the sake of seeking profit, takes various grains and other goods and lends them to others, measuring with bushels and dou, establishing contracts together, up to incurring offenses as explained in detail above.

original: 苾芻為求利故，納取珍寶真珠貝玉計時取利，得不得利亦如上說。
analyzed: 苾芻為求利故，納取珍寶真珠貝玉計時取利，得不得利亦如上說。
translated: A bhikṣu, for the sake of seeking profit, accepts precious treasures such as pearls, shells, jade, and takes interest according to the time. Whether he obtains profit or not is also explained as above.

original: 若苾芻為利故以己衣換他衣，求換之時得惡作罪；
analyzed: 若苾芻為利故以己衣換他衣，求換之時得惡作罪；
translated: If a bhikṣu, for the sake of profit, exchanges his own clothes for others' clothes, when seeking the exchange he commits an offense of wrong conduct;
when he obtains it, he incurs the offense of pārājika.

original: 又復世尊在廣嚴城獼猴池側重閣堂中，於此城中栗㚲毘等，自所住宅皆高六重七重，見諸苾芻所居卑下，即便為造高六七重嚴好房舍。
analyzed: 又復世尊在廣嚴城獼猴池側重閣堂中，於此城中栗㚲毘等，自所住宅皆高六重七重，見諸苾芻所居卑下，即便為造高六七重嚴好房舍。
translated: Moreover, the World-Honored One was at the multi-storied hall beside the Monkey Pond in the city of Vṛji. In this city, the Licchavis and others had their own houses as high as six or seven stories. Seeing that the dwellings of the bhikṣus were low, they immediately built tall and beautiful houses with six or seven stories.

original: 其舍經久多並隤壞，施主見已咸作是念：
analyzed: 其舍經久多並隤壞，施主見已咸作是念：
translated: After many years, the houses were mostly dilapidated. The donors saw this and all had this thought:

original: 「我等現存寺皆破壞，命過之後其欲如何？
analyzed: 「我等現存寺皆破壞，命過之後其欲如何？
translated: While we are alive, the temples are all ruined. After we die, what will happen to them?

original: 我等宜應施無盡物令其營造。
analyzed: 我等宜應施無盡物令其營造。
translated: We should give inexhaustible goods to them to repair them.
They then took the donated goods to the bhikṣus and said:
Noble ones!

original: 此是無盡施物，為擬修補當可受之。
analyzed: 此是無盡施物，為擬修補當可受之。
translated: This is inexhaustible donated goods, intended for repairs. Please accept them.
The bhikṣus replied:
The World-Honored One has established precepts. We are not allowed to accept them.

original: 」時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛告諸苾芻：
analyzed: 」時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛告諸苾芻：
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus reported this matter to the Buddha. The Buddha told the bhikṣus:

original: 「若為僧伽有所營造，受無盡物。
analyzed: 「若為僧伽有所營造，受無盡物。
translated: If there is construction work for the Saṃgha and one receives inexhaustible goods,

original: 然苾芻毘訶羅應三重作，若苾芻尼應兩重作。
analyzed: 然苾芻毘訶羅應三重作，若苾芻尼應兩重作。
translated: but the vihāra of the bhikṣus should be made three stories high, and that of the bhikṣuṇīs should be made two stories high.

original: 」時諸苾芻得無盡物置房庫中，時施主來問言：
analyzed: 」時諸苾芻得無盡物置房庫中，時施主來問言：
translated: At that time the bhikṣus obtained inexhaustible goods and placed them in the room treasury. Then the donor came and asked:
Noble ones!
Why is the vihāra still not repaired?
The bhikṣus replied:
Wise one!
It is because there is no money.
The donor said:
Didn't I offer inexhaustible goods?
They replied:
Wise one!

original: 其無盡物我豈食之，安僧庫中今皆現在。
analyzed: 其無盡物我豈食之，安僧庫中今皆現在。
translated: How could we eat those inexhaustible goods? We have placed them in the Saṃgha treasury and they are all present now.
The donor said:

original: 「其無盡物不合如是，我之家中豈無安處？
analyzed: 「其無盡物不合如是，我之家中豈無安處？
translated: Those inexhaustible goods should not be treated like this. Aren't there places to store them in our homes?
Why not exchange them to seek profit?
The bhikṣus replied:
The Buddha has prohibited us from seeking profit.

original: 」時諸苾芻以此因緣具白世尊，世尊告曰：
analyzed: 」時諸苾芻以此因緣具白世尊，世尊告曰：
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus reported this matter in detail to the World-Honored One. The World-Honored One said:
If it is for the sake of the Saṃgha, you should seek profit.

original: 」聞佛語已，諸有信心婆羅門居士等，為佛法僧故施無盡物，此三寶物亦應迴轉求利，所得利物還於三寶而作供養。
analyzed: 」聞佛語已，諸有信心婆羅門居士等，為佛法僧故施無盡物，此三寶物亦應迴轉求利，所得利物還於三寶而作供養。
translated: Having heard the Buddha's words, the faithful brāhmaṇas and householders made inexhaustible offerings for the sake of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha. The inexhaustible offerings of these Three Jewels should also be used to seek profit, and the profits obtained should be used to make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: 時諸苾芻還將此物與彼施主，索利之時多與諍競，便作是語：
analyzed: 時諸苾芻還將此物與彼施主，索利之時多與諍競，便作是語：
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus returned these things to the donors and sought interest. When the time came to collect the interest, there were many disputes. They said:
Noble ones!
How can my own property cause disputes?

original: 」時諸苾芻以此因緣具白世尊，世尊告曰：
analyzed: 」時諸苾芻以此因緣具白世尊，世尊告曰：
translated: At that time, the bhikṣus reported this matter in detail to the World-Honored One. The World-Honored One said:
You should not do business with them.

original: 」復共富貴者而為出息，索物之時恃官勢故不肯相還，佛言：
analyzed: 」復共富貴者而為出息，索物之時恃官勢故不肯相還，佛言：
translated: They then did business with the wealthy, but when it was time to collect the goods, they were unwilling to return them, relying on their official power. The Buddha said:
You should not do business with them.

original: 」復共貧人而為出息，索時無物，佛言：
analyzed: 」復共貧人而為出息，索時無物，佛言：
translated: They then lent money to the poor together, but when it was time to collect, there was nothing. The Buddha said:

original: 「若與物時應可分明，兩倍納質書其券契，并立保證記其年月，安上座名及授事人字。
analyzed: 「若與物時應可分明，兩倍納質書其券契，并立保證記其年月，安上座名及授事人字。
translated: When giving things, they should be clearly distinguished. Double the collateral should be taken, and a promissory note should be written, along with establishing a guarantor and recording the year and month, and the names of the senior monk and the monk in charge should be added.

original: 假令信心鄔波索迦受五學處，亦應兩倍而納其質。
analyzed: 假令信心鄔波索迦受五學處，亦應兩倍而納其質。
translated: Even if a faithful upāsaka who has taken the five precepts should also double the collateral.

original: 」又無犯者，謂最初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。
analyzed: 」又無犯者，謂最初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。
translated: There is no offense if it is the first offense, or if one is insane, mentally disturbed, or in pain.

original: 20 販賣學處販賣學處第二十佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
analyzed: 20 販賣學處販賣學處第二十佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
translated: The training rule on buying and selling, the twentieth training rule. The Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove near Śrāvastī.

original: 時六眾苾芻種種交易取與買賣。
analyzed: 時六眾苾芻種種交易取與買賣。
translated: At that time, the group of six monks engaged in various transactions, taking and giving, buying and selling.
Then the non-Buddhist practitioners each gave rise to contempt:

original: 「此諸沙門釋子不生厭離，而於今者為交易事取與賣買。
analyzed: 「此諸沙門釋子不生厭離，而於今者為交易事取與賣買。
translated: These śramaṇas, sons of Śākya, do not give rise to disgust, and now they engage in transactions, taking and giving, buying and selling.

original: 此禿沙門與諸俗人有何異處？
analyzed: 此禿沙門與諸俗人有何異處？
translated: What difference is there between these shaven-headed śramaṇas and the laypeople?

original: 誰復能於此禿人處沙門釋子以諸飲食而與供養？
analyzed: 誰復能於此禿人處沙門釋子以諸飲食而與供養？
translated: Who would be able to offer food and drink to these shaven-headed monks, the disciples of Śākyamuni?

original: 」時諸苾芻以此因緣具白世尊。
analyzed: 」時諸苾芻以此因緣具白世尊。
translated: At that time the bhikṣus brought this matter to inform the World-Honored One in detail.

original: 世尊以此因緣集苾芻僧，呵責六眾廣說如前，乃至「我今制其學處，應如是說：
analyzed: 世尊以此因緣集苾芻僧，呵責六眾廣說如前，乃至「我今制其學處，應如是說：
translated: The World-Honored One, because of this matter, assembled the bhikṣu saṅgha and reproached the group of six as explained above, up to I now establish the training rule that should be said like this:

original: 若復苾芻種種賣買者，泥薩祇波逸底迦。
analyzed: 若復苾芻種種賣買者，泥薩祇波逸底迦。
translated: If a bhikṣu engages in various buying and selling, he commits a nissaggiya pācittiya offense.
If a bhikṣu refers to the group of six.

original: 種種者，謂非一事。🔽取與賣買者，取謂餘處物賤、此處物貴，即從彼取來也。
analyzed: 種種者，謂非一事。 取與賣買者，取謂餘處物賤、此處物貴，即從彼取來也。
translated: Various means not just one thing.

original: 與者，謂此處賤、餘處貴，即從此持去，豐時買取、儉時當賣。
analyzed: 與者，謂此處賤、餘處貴，即從此持去，豐時買取、儉時當賣。
translated: Buying and selling means buying from other places where goods are cheap and selling in places where they are expensive, and taking from here where they are cheap and bringing to other places where they are expensive. When there is plenty, buy; when there is a shortage, sell.
Nissaggiya is explained in detail as above.

original: 此中犯者，苾芻為利故而作賣，買時惡作；
analyzed: 此中犯者，苾芻為利故而作賣，買時惡作；
translated: In this case, if a bhikṣu engages in buying and selling for profit, he commits an offense of wrong conduct when buying;
When selling, there is a pārājika offense.

original: 若為利故買、不為利賣，買時惡作；
analyzed: 若為利故買、不為利賣，買時惡作；
translated: If one buys for profit but sells without seeking profit, there is an offense of wrong conduct in buying;
there is no offense in selling.

original: 若不為利買、為利故賣，買時無犯；
analyzed: 若不為利買、為利故賣，買時無犯；
translated: If one buys without seeking profit but sells for profit, there is no offense in buying;
there is a pārājika offense in selling.

original: 不為利買、不為利賣，二俱無犯。
analyzed: 不為利買、不為利賣，二俱無犯。
translated: If one neither buys nor sells for profit, there is no offense in either case.

original: 若向餘方買物而去，元不求利，到處賣時雖復得利，而無有犯。
analyzed: 若向餘方買物而去，元不求利，到處賣時雖復得利，而無有犯。
translated: If one buys goods in one place with no intention of seeking profit, and sells them elsewhere even if one obtains a profit, there is no offense.

original: 又無犯者，謂初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。🔽第三攝頌曰：🔽二鉢二織師，　　奪衣并急施，🔽阿蘭若雨衣，　　迴僧七日藥。
analyzed: 又無犯者，謂初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。🔽第三攝頌曰：🔽二鉢二織師，　　奪衣并急施，🔽阿蘭若雨衣，　　迴僧七日藥。
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or if one is insane, mentally disturbed, or in pain.

original: 21 得長缽過十日不分別學處得長鉢過十日不分別學處第二十一佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
analyzed: 21 得長缽過十日不分別學處得長鉢過十日不分別學處第二十一佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
translated: The training rule on not determining an extra alms bowl after ten days, the twenty-first training rule. The Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove near Śrāvastī.
At that time, Upananda thought like this:

original: 「所有我等求利之處佛悉制戒，遂令我等求覓無由，所有利養因斯斷絕。
analyzed: 「所有我等求利之處佛悉制戒，遂令我等求覓無由，所有利養因斯斷絕。
translated: The Buddha has made rules for everything we seek to benefit ourselves, making it impossible for us to seek. All the offerings have been cut off.
He stayed there, worried.

original: 時有六十人出遊園觀欲為讌會，時鄔波難陀見而生念：
analyzed: 時有六十人出遊園觀欲為讌會，時鄔波難陀見而生念：
translated: At that time, sixty people went out to a park to have a feast. When Upananda saw this, he thought:

original: 「若於此輩不獲財物者，我不更名鄔波難陀矣。
analyzed: 「若於此輩不獲財物者，我不更名鄔波難陀矣。
translated: If I cannot obtain wealth from these people, I will no longer be called Upananda.

original: 」即便取一好鉢圓滿光淨堪受用者，以帒盛之置於腋下詣讌會所，對彼一人為其說法令生深信。
analyzed: 」即便取一好鉢圓滿光淨堪受用者，以帒盛之置於腋下詣讌會所，對彼一人為其說法令生深信。
translated: He then took a good bowl that was full, bright, and suitable for use, put it in a bag, placed it under his arm, went to the feast, and spoke the Dharma for one of them, causing him to give rise to deep faith.
After he had faith, he asked:
Noble one!
Why have you come here?
Upananda said:
Wise one!
I came for a bowl.
He replied:

original: 「我今無鉢，若有買處買以相施。
analyzed: 「我今無鉢，若有買處買以相施。
translated: I don't have a bowl now. If there's a place to buy one, I'll buy it and give it to you.

original: 」時鄔波難陀便於腋下抽出其鉢而呈示之，問曰：
analyzed: 」時鄔波難陀便於腋下抽出其鉢而呈示之，問曰：
translated: Then Upananda took out his bowl from under his arm and showed it to him, asking:
How much is a bowl like this worth?
He replied:
It's worth sixty kārṣāpaṇas.
He said:

original: 「我與六十迦利沙波拏，仁當自買。
analyzed: 「我與六十迦利沙波拏，仁當自買。
translated: I'll give you sixty kārṣāpaṇas. You should buy it yourself.
Upananda said:
Wise one!

original: 願汝長命無病，今此施物為莊嚴心，是心資助是定資糧得勝上果，於人天中常為法器。
analyzed: 願汝長命無病，今此施物為莊嚴心，是心資助是定資糧得勝上果，於人天中常為法器。
translated: May you have a long life without illness. Now, this gift is to adorn the mind. It is a support for the mind, a provision for concentration, and attains a supreme fruit. In the human and heavenly realms, you will always be a vessel for the Dharma.

original: 」如是六十人人別各乞六十迦利沙波拏，便捨而去。
analyzed: 」如是六十人人別各乞六十迦利沙波拏，便捨而去。
translated: In this way, each of the sixty people begged for sixty kārṣāpaṇas, then left.

original: 時彼諸人各讌會已詳集一處，時有一人告諸人曰：
analyzed: 時彼諸人各讌會已詳集一處，時有一人告諸人曰：
translated: At that time, after each of those people had finished their feast, they gathered together in one place. One person said to the others:

original: 「君等隨喜，我於向見聖者鄔波難陀釋種出家，為大法將善閑三藏無礙辯才，我以六十迦利沙波拏用充鉢價。
analyzed: 「君等隨喜，我於向見聖者鄔波難陀釋種出家，為大法將善閑三藏無礙辯才，我以六十迦利沙波拏用充鉢價。
translated: You may rejoice, I have just seen the Venerable Upananda, the son of the Śākyas who has gone forth, who is a great Dharma general well-versed in the Tripiṭaka with unobstructed eloquence. I have given him sixty kārṣāpaṇas as the price for his alms bowl.
When those people heard these words, they all said:
We will also give him sixty kārṣāpaṇas.
They then discussed together:

original: 「君等頗知若一苾芻可須幾鉢？
analyzed: 「君等頗知若一苾芻可須幾鉢？
translated: Do you know how many alms bowls a single bhikṣu needs?
Each said:
We don't know.

original: 」時有苾芻從此而過諸人問言：
analyzed: 」時有苾芻從此而過諸人問言：
translated: At that time, a bhikṣu passed by and the people asked him:
Venerable!
How many alms bowls does a single bhikṣu need?
He replied:
He only needs one alms bowl.
When they heard this, they all gave rise to disdain:
The Śramaṇas, the sons of Śākya, are greedy for much gain and support.
This is the origin story, but the precept has not yet been established.

original: 時六眾苾芻多得長鉢，不自受用，亦復不與諸餘苾芻。
analyzed: 時六眾苾芻多得長鉢，不自受用，亦復不與諸餘苾芻。
translated: At that time, the group of six monks obtained many extra bowls, and neither used them themselves nor gave them to other monks.
The monks of few desires saw this and despised it,

original: 「云何苾芻多畜長鉢，不自受用亦不與人？
analyzed: 「云何苾芻多畜長鉢，不自受用亦不與人？
translated: saying, How can monks hoard extra bowls, neither using them themselves nor giving them to others?
They brought this matter to inform the World-Honored One in detail.

original: 佛以此緣集苾芻眾，呵責六眾苾芻：
analyzed: 佛以此緣集苾芻眾，呵責六眾苾芻：
translated: The Buddha, on this account, assembled the assembly of monks and reprimanded the group of six monks:
How can you hoard extra bowls?
Explained in detail as above, up to should be explained like this:

original: 「若復苾芻畜長鉢過十日不分別者，泥薩祇波逸底迦。
analyzed: 「若復苾芻畜長鉢過十日不分別者，泥薩祇波逸底迦。
translated: If a monk keeps an extra bowl for more than ten days without making a decision, it is Nissaggiya Pācittiya.
Monk refers to the group of six and others.
More than ten days means more than ten nights.

original: 長鉢者，除守持鉢，餘者名長。
analyzed: 長鉢者，除守持鉢，餘者名長。
translated: Extra bowl refers to all bowls except the one in possession.
Keeps means to make it one's own.

original: 若更畜者得捨墮罪，捨之法式如上廣說。
analyzed: 若更畜者得捨墮罪，捨之法式如上廣說。
translated: If one keeps it again, one commits an offense of abandoning and relinquishing. The method of relinquishment is explained in detail above.
What are the characteristics of an offense in this context?

original: 若苾芻月一日得鉢，於十日內應持、應分別、應捨、應與他。
analyzed: 若苾芻月一日得鉢，於十日內應持、應分別、應捨、應與他。
translated: If a bhikṣu obtains a bowl on the first day of the month, within ten days he should keep it, distinguish it, relinquish it, or give it to others.

original: 如是次第及以超間，如初衣戒中廣說其事，乃至捨之法式皆悉同前。
analyzed: 如是次第及以超間，如初衣戒中廣說其事，乃至捨之法式皆悉同前。
translated: In this way, the sequence and the skipping in between are explained in detail in the case of the first robe rule, and the method of relinquishment is all the same as before.

original: 若小、若白色或為擬與，欲受戒人者無犯。
analyzed: 若小、若白色或為擬與，欲受戒人者無犯。
translated: If it is small, or white, or intended for a person who wishes to receive the precepts, there is no offense.

original: 又無犯者，謂初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。
analyzed: 又無犯者，謂初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。
translated: Moreover, there is no offense for a first-time offender, or one who is insane, mentally disturbed, or tormented by pain.

original: 22 乞缽學處乞鉢學處第二十二佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
analyzed: 22 乞缽學處乞鉢學處第二十二佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
translated: The training rule on begging for bowls, the twenty-second. The Buddha was at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove near Śrāvastī.

original: 於此城中有一賣香童子有一好鉢，圓滿光淨堪得受用。
analyzed: 於此城中有一賣香童子有一好鉢，圓滿光淨堪得受用。
translated: In this city there was a perfumer's son who had a good bowl, full and bright, suitable for use.

original: 有乞食苾芻，於日初分入城乞食巡至市中，賣香童子見而告曰：
analyzed: 有乞食苾芻，於日初分入城乞食巡至市中，賣香童子見而告曰：
translated: There was a begging monk who, in the morning, entered the city to beg for food. He went to the market and a perfume seller's son saw him and said:
Venerable!

original: 我有好鉢堪得受用，必若須者隨意持將。
analyzed: 我有好鉢堪得受用，必若須者隨意持將。
translated: I have a good alms bowl that is suitable for use. If you need it, take it as you wish.
The monk replied:
I already have an alms bowl.
The boy said:

original: 「若餘苾芻有須鉢者幸可遣來。
analyzed: 「若餘苾芻有須鉢者幸可遣來。
translated: If other monks need an alms bowl, please send them here.
He answered:
Yes, I will.

original: 」時彼苾芻乞得食已，還逝多林食訖洗器，告諸苾芻曰：
analyzed: 」時彼苾芻乞得食已，還逝多林食訖洗器，告諸苾芻曰：
translated: Then the monk, having obtained his food, returned to Jetavana. After eating and washing his bowl, he told the other monks:
Venerable!

original: 某處鋪上有賣香人，有一好鉢。
analyzed: 某處鋪上有賣香人，有一好鉢。
translated: In a certain place, there is a perfume seller who has a good alms bowl.
If you need an alms bowl, go and get it.

original: 」時鄔波難陀去斯不遠，聞此語聲便作是念：
analyzed: 」時鄔波難陀去斯不遠，聞此語聲便作是念：
translated: At that time, Upananda was not far away. Hearing these words, he thought:

original: 「我宜呵彼乞食苾芻更莫傳說，勿令黑鉢之徒聞斯語已跳走而去。
analyzed: 「我宜呵彼乞食苾芻更莫傳說，勿令黑鉢之徒聞斯語已跳走而去。
translated: I should scold that begging monk and tell him not to spread this matter further, lest those black-bowl practitioners hear this and run away.
He then said to the begging monk:
Venerable!

original: 食信心食更無別言，但肆貪心唯論衣鉢。
analyzed: 食信心食更無別言，但肆貪心唯論衣鉢。
translated: The food of faith is not to be spoken of, but only to be greedy for robes and bowls.
The begging monk thought:

original: 「世間多求常貪覓者，鄔波難陀即是一數。
analyzed: 「世間多求常貪覓者，鄔波難陀即是一數。
translated: Those who always seek much in the world and are greedy for gain, Upananda is one of them.

original: 此聞我語尚致譏呵，若更有餘耆年宿德聞我此言，更重呵叱。
analyzed: 此聞我語尚致譏呵，若更有餘耆年宿德聞我此言，更重呵叱。
translated: If he hears my words, he will still rebuke me. If there are other elders who hear my words, they will rebuke me even more.
So he remained silent and did not dare to speak again.

original: 時鄔波難陀告乞食者曰：
analyzed: 時鄔波難陀告乞食者曰：
translated: Then Upananda said to the begging monk:
Venerable!

original: 汝親教師是我知識，由此緣故我遂見呵，勿懷悒恨。
analyzed: 汝親教師是我知識，由此緣故我遂見呵，勿懷悒恨。
translated: Your preceptor is my acquaintance. It is for this reason that I rebuked you. Do not be upset.
He replied:
Venerable!
If I speak again, please rebuke me again.
Upananda said:
Venerable!

original: 我向未善審聽，如何說云鉢與非鉢？
analyzed: 我向未善審聽，如何說云鉢與非鉢？
translated: I did not listen carefully just now, how can you say that the bowl is not a bowl?

original: 大德若未曉了何因見責。
analyzed: 大德若未曉了何因見責。
translated: If you do not understand the reason, why do you blame me?

original: 雖然汝可更為說彼童子住在何處？
analyzed: 雖然汝可更為說彼童子住在何處？
translated: However, you can tell me again where that boy is staying?
He replied:

original: 「彼人住在某鋪，有一好鉢極堪受用。
analyzed: 「彼人住在某鋪，有一好鉢極堪受用。
translated: That person is staying at a certain shop, where there is a good bowl that is very useful.
He told me:
'If there is a monk who needs a bowl, send him to buy it.'
Upananda said:
I heard these words, but I still did not understand clearly.

original: 」作是語已即著僧伽胝，疾行而去詣彼市中。
analyzed: 」作是語已即著僧伽胝，疾行而去詣彼市中。
translated: Having said this, he put on his saṃghāṭī and quickly went to that market.

original: 時彼童子遙見急行作如是念：
analyzed: 時彼童子遙見急行作如是念：
translated: At that time, the boy saw him coming quickly and thought like this:

original: 「我今觀彼豪俠苾芻，威勢麁猛必來至此奪我鉢將。
analyzed: 「我今觀彼豪俠苾芻，威勢麁猛必來至此奪我鉢將。
translated: I now observe that this powerful monk has a rough and fierce appearance, he will surely come here to take away my bowl.
He then took the bowl and placed it deep under the bed.

original: 時鄔波難陀遙見藏舉報言：
analyzed: 時鄔波難陀遙見藏舉報言：
translated: At that time, Upananda saw from afar that the treasure was raised and reported:
Wise one!
Why is the treasure bowl hidden?

original: 」即便展手自取其鉢，而呪願曰：
analyzed: 」即便展手自取其鉢，而呪願曰：
translated: Then he stretched out his hand to take the bowl himself and made a wish, saying:
May you be free from illness and live a long life.
The details are explained as above.
The boy replied:
Noble one!

original: 我興易人以利活命，不以虛言而即相與，可酬價將去。
analyzed: 我興易人以利活命，不以虛言而即相與，可酬價將去。
translated: We merchants make a living through profit, not by empty words. You can pay the price and take it away.
He said in reply:
Can you sell the vessel of an immortal?
He spoke a verse, saying:

original: 「若人施瓦器，　　當獲於金鉢；
analyzed: 「若人施瓦器，　　當獲於金鉢；
translated: If a person gives a clay vessel, they will obtain a golden bowl;

original: 此報定不虛，　　何故生憂苦？
analyzed: 此報定不虛，　　何故生憂苦？
translated: This retribution is certainly not false, so why be worried and suffer?
The boy said:
Noble one!
Even if you speak a lot, it cannot be had without a price.
Upananda said:

original: 「汝今慳惜此鉢，當來必墮大癭鬼中。
analyzed: 「汝今慳惜此鉢，當來必墮大癭鬼中。
translated: If you are stingy with this bowl now, you will certainly fall into the realm of a ghost with a large goiter in the future.

original: 」當惡語時有一長者來至其所，口云：
analyzed: 」當惡語時有一長者來至其所，口云：
translated: At that time, a certain elder came to his place and said:
I respectfully pay homage to the Venerable Upananda.
Then Upananda replied:
Wise one!
Who needs your empty homage?
The elder answered:

original: 「何曾聖者所出言教我不依隨？
analyzed: 「何曾聖者所出言教我不依隨？
translated: How could I ever not follow the teachings spoken by the noble one?
He said:

original: 「若如是者，可買此鉢持以施我。
analyzed: 「若如是者，可買此鉢持以施我。
translated: If it is so, then buy this bowl and give it to me.
The elder then asked the boy:
How much is the price of this bowl?
The boy answered:
That much.
The elder said:

original: 「所論價直我後當還。🔽」是時童子即便以鉢授與長者，長者取鉢奉施鄔波難陀。
analyzed: 「所論價直我後當還。 」是時童子即便以鉢授與長者，長者取鉢奉施鄔波難陀。
translated: I will return the agreed price later.🔽At that time, the boy then gave the bowl to the elder, and the elder took the bowl and offered it to Upananda.

original: 鄔波難陀即受其鉢呪願云：
analyzed: 鄔波難陀即受其鉢呪願云：
translated: Upananda then accepted the bowl and made a vow, saying:

original: 「願得長命無病，乃至於人天中常為法器。
analyzed: 「願得長命無病，乃至於人天中常為法器。
translated: May I attain a long life without illness, and in the human and heavenly realms always be a vessel of the Dharma.
Explained in detail as above.
The elder then left.
Upananda said to the boy:
Fool!

original: 汝言謂我鄔波難陀不能乞得少許鉢價。
analyzed: 汝言謂我鄔波難陀不能乞得少許鉢價。
translated: You say that I, Upananda, cannot beg for a little money for a bowl.

original: 汝今由此慳惜鉢故，必當定墮大癭鬼中。
analyzed: 汝今由此慳惜鉢故，必當定墮大癭鬼中。
translated: Because of your stinginess with the bowl now, you will certainly fall into the realm of the great goiter ghosts.
The boy said:
Why boast so much?
You have obtained the bowl, and I have now received the money.
You should leave quickly, what need is there for much talk!

original: 」時鄔波難陀便持此鉢入逝多林，便以其鉢示諸苾芻，告言：
analyzed: 」時鄔波難陀便持此鉢入逝多林，便以其鉢示諸苾芻，告言：
translated: Then Upananda took the bowl and entered Jetavana, and showed the bowl to the monks, saying:
Venerable ones!
How is this bowl?

original: 」時有少年苾芻問鄔波難陀曰：
analyzed: 」時有少年苾芻問鄔波難陀曰：
translated: Then a young monk asked Upananda:
Elder!
Are there any other bowls?
He replied:
Yes.

original: 若如是者現有一鉢，合更求餘。
analyzed: 若如是者現有一鉢，合更求餘。
translated: If that is the case, I already have one bowl, so I should not seek another.
Upananda said:

original: 「我以脚踏怨家頂上更畜餘鉢。
analyzed: 「我以脚踏怨家頂上更畜餘鉢。
translated: I step on the head of my enemy with my foot and keep the other bowl.
The young man asked:
Venerable!
How can there be an enemy?
Upananda said:

original: 「汝即是我第一怨家，由汝不許我畜二鉢。
analyzed: 「汝即是我第一怨家，由汝不許我畜二鉢。
translated: You are my first enemy, because you do not allow me to keep two bowls.

original: 」少欲苾芻聞是語已共生嫌賤：
analyzed: 」少欲苾芻聞是語已共生嫌賤：
translated: The monks of few desires heard this and despised him, saying:

original: 「云何苾芻現有一鉢而更求餘？
analyzed: 「云何苾芻現有一鉢而更求餘？
translated: How can a monk who already has a bowl seek another?
They then went to the World-Honored One and reported this matter in detail.

original: 世尊以此因緣集諸苾芻，問鄔波難陀，廣說如前。
analyzed: 世尊以此因緣集諸苾芻，問鄔波難陀，廣說如前。
translated: The World-Honored One, for this reason, assembled the monks and asked Upananda, explaining in detail as before.
After reprimanding him in various ways, he told the monks:

original: 「從今已去苾芻若現有鉢更不應求。
analyzed: 「從今已去苾芻若現有鉢更不應求。
translated: From now on, if a monk already has a bowl, he should not seek another.

original: 」時有乞食苾芻其鉢有孔，便持此鉢入城乞食，有人施󰉓即以鉢帒盛之，次得濕餅以鉢而受，孔中漿出便濕其󰉓復污鉢囊，有多蒼蠅遍皆附繞。
analyzed: 」時有乞食苾芻其鉢有孔，便持此鉢入城乞食，有人施󰉓即以鉢帒盛之，次得濕餅以鉢而受，孔中漿出便濕其󰉓復污鉢囊，有多蒼蠅遍皆附繞。
translated: At that time, there was a begging monk whose bowl had a hole. He took this bowl into the city to beg for food. Someone offered him flour and he put it in the bowl bag. He then received a wet cake in the bowl. The juice came out of the hole and moistened the flour, also staining the bowl bag. There were many blue flies all over it.

original: 諸小男女隨逐而行，告言：
analyzed: 諸小男女隨逐而行，告言：
translated: The young boys and girls followed him and said:
Venerable!

original: 曾修多眷屬業，如大商主長者貴人，多諸徒眾之所圍繞，蒼蠅眷屬亦復如是。
analyzed: 曾修多眷屬業，如大商主長者貴人，多諸徒眾之所圍繞，蒼蠅眷屬亦復如是。
translated: Have you ever cultivated the karma of having many followers? Like a great merchant, an elder, or a noble person, surrounded by many attendants, the swarm of blue flies is also like this.

original: 」時給孤獨長者見諸童子，報言：
analyzed: 」時給孤獨長者見諸童子，報言：
translated: Then the Elder Anāthapiṇḍada saw the children and said to them:
Why do you tease the venerable one?
The children replied:

original: 「我等豈敢輒為調弄，然此聖者昔日曾修多眷屬業，譬如商主長者貴人眾所圍繞，隨從蒼蠅亦復如是。
analyzed: 「我等豈敢輒為調弄，然此聖者昔日曾修多眷屬業，譬如商主長者貴人眾所圍繞，隨從蒼蠅亦復如是。
translated: How dare we tease him? However, this venerable one has previously cultivated the karma of having many followers. It is like a merchant, an elder, or a noble person surrounded by many people. The swarm of blue flies is also like this.
The elder heard this and said to the bhikṣus:
Noble ones!

original: 於佛世尊端嚴教中而為出家，何因作此羞恥之事？
analyzed: 於佛世尊端嚴教中而為出家，何因作此羞恥之事？
translated: Why do you, who have gone forth in the Buddha Bhagavān's dignified teaching, do such shameful things?
The bhikṣus replied:
What is shameful about it?

original: 然佛世尊制諸苾芻，現有一鉢更不應求。
analyzed: 然佛世尊制諸苾芻，現有一鉢更不應求。
translated: However, the Buddha Bhagavān has decreed that bhikṣus should not seek another alms bowl if they already have one.
The elder said:
Noble ones!

original: 豈可唯畜如此穿壞鉢耶？
analyzed: 豈可唯畜如此穿壞鉢耶？
translated: How can you only keep such a worn-out alms bowl?
The bhikṣus heard this and reported it to the Buddha. The Buddha said:
Bhikṣus!
If the alms bowl has holes, it should be repaired.

original: 」時諸苾芻便以五種鎔濕之物，謂黑糖、黃臘、紫礦、鉛、錫，著熱物時即便脫落。
analyzed: 」時諸苾芻便以五種鎔濕之物，謂黑糖、黃臘、紫礦、鉛、錫，著熱物時即便脫落。
translated: At that time the bhikṣus used five kinds of melted substances, namely black sugar, yellow wax, purple ore, lead, and tin, which fell off when heated.

original: 時諸苾芻以事白佛，佛言：
analyzed: 時諸苾芻以事白佛，佛言：
translated: At that time the bhikṣus reported this matter to the Buddha. The Buddha said:

original: 「不應用此而綴於鉢，除此五種鎔濕之物，應作五種乾綴。
analyzed: 「不應用此而綴於鉢，除此五種鎔濕之物，應作五種乾綴。
translated: You should not use these to mend the bowl. Apart from these five kinds of molten substances, you should make five kinds of dry repairs.
The monks did not know which five.
The Buddha said:

original: 「看孔大小應以釘釘，或於孔內安鐵鍱打之，或安鐵鍱四邊釘釘，或作摩竭魚齒或安屑末。
analyzed: 「看孔大小應以釘釘，或於孔內安鐵鍱打之，或安鐵鍱四邊釘釘，或作摩竭魚齒或安屑末。
translated: Look at the size of the hole and use a nail to fix it, or put an iron patch inside the hole and hit it, or put an iron patch on the four sides and nail it, or make it like a makaras tooth or put powder on it.
The monks did not know which powder to use.
The Buddha said:
There are two kinds of powder:
iron powder and stone powder.
Use iron bowls and earthenware bowls as appropriate.

original: 」苾芻以水研末安鉢孔中尋便墮落，佛言：
analyzed: 」苾芻以水研末安鉢孔中尋便墮落，佛言：
translated: The monks ground the powder with water and put it in the hole of the bowl, but it fell out. The Buddha said:
You should grind it with oil and put it in the hole.

original: 」諸苾芻依教作已，以猛火燒亦還墮落，或火太微亦復還墮，佛言：
analyzed: 」諸苾芻依教作已，以猛火燒亦還墮落，或火太微亦復還墮，佛言：
translated: The monks did as instructed, but when they burned it with a strong fire it fell out again. When the fire was too weak it also fell out again. The Buddha said:
You should burn it at a moderate temperature.
After burning, it became rough and hard. The Buddha said:
You should rub it with something.

original: 」苾芻以水揩摩，補物墮落，佛言：
analyzed: 」苾芻以水揩摩，補物墮落，佛言：
translated: The monks rubbed it with water, and the repair fell off. The Buddha said:
Rub it with oil.

original: 若鉢有細孔，以沙糖和泥遍塗孔處准法燒之。
analyzed: 若鉢有細孔，以沙糖和泥遍塗孔處准法燒之。
translated: If the bowl has small holes, apply mud mixed with sugar throughout the hole and burn it according to the method.

original: 若鉢有璺，應鑽作孔以鋦綴之，是名綴鉢法。
analyzed: 若鉢有璺，應鑽作孔以鋦綴之，是名綴鉢法。
translated: If the bowl has cracks, drill a hole and repair it with a patch. This is called the method of repairing bowls.
The Buddha told the monks to repair bowls in five ways.

original: 時有乞食苾芻，失手墮鉢便為五片。
analyzed: 時有乞食苾芻，失手墮鉢便為五片。
translated: At that time, a begging monk dropped his bowl by accident and it broke into five pieces.

original: 時彼苾芻多鑽為孔，以細繩連綴持將乞食，佛言：
analyzed: 時彼苾芻多鑽為孔，以細繩連綴持將乞食，佛言：
translated: The monk then drilled many holes, strung them together with a fine rope, and held it to beg for food. The Buddha said:
All bowls should be washed clean.

original: 」彼便解綴洗繩淨已還復繫綴，遂致終日廢修善品。
analyzed: 」彼便解綴洗繩淨已還復繫綴，遂致終日廢修善品。
translated: The monk then untied it, washed the rope, restrung it, and spent the whole day doing that instead of practicing wholesome activities.
Other monks saw this and said:
Venerable!

original: 汝但以此解而復綴，疎洗盂器為善品耶？
analyzed: 汝但以此解而復綴，疎洗盂器為善品耶？
translated: Do you just use this understanding to continue patching and washing the bowls and utensils as a wholesome practice?🔽He replied:
Venerable!

original: 如佛所制，若鉢破者應為五種乾綴。
analyzed: 如佛所制，若鉢破者應為五種乾綴。
translated: As instructed by the Buddha, if a bowl is broken, it should be repaired with five types of dry patches.
At that time the bhikṣus reported this matter to the Buddha. The Buddha said:

original: 「若鉢難得隨意修理，若易得處應可棄之更覓好者。
analyzed: 「若鉢難得隨意修理，若易得處應可棄之更覓好者。
translated: If bowls are difficult to obtain, repair them as you wish. If they are easy to obtain, you should discard them and look for better ones.

original: 」爾時世尊讚歎持戒，廣說如前，乃至「為諸苾芻制其學處，應如是說：
analyzed: 」爾時世尊讚歎持戒，廣說如前，乃至「為諸苾芻制其學處，應如是說：
translated: At that time the World-Honored One praised observing the precepts, explaining in detail as before, and said, For the sake of the bhikṣus, I will establish a precept, which should be thus stated:

original: 「若復苾芻有鉢減五綴堪得受用，為好故更求餘鉢，得者泥薩祇波逸底迦。
analyzed: 「若復苾芻有鉢減五綴堪得受用，為好故更求餘鉢，得者泥薩祇波逸底迦。
translated: If a bhikṣu has a bowl with less than five patches that can be used, but seeks another bowl for the sake of a better one, he commits a nisśaya offense.

original: 彼苾芻當於眾中捨此鉢，取眾中最下鉢與彼苾芻，報言：
analyzed: 彼苾芻當於眾中捨此鉢，取眾中最下鉢與彼苾芻，報言：
translated: That bhikṣu should give up that bowl to the assembly. The worst bowl among the assembly's bowls should be given to that bhikṣu, and he should be told:

original: 『此鉢還汝，不應守持、不應分別亦不施人，應自審詳徐徐受用，乃至破來應護持，此是其法。
analyzed: 『此鉢還汝，不應守持、不應分別亦不施人，應自審詳徐徐受用，乃至破來應護持，此是其法。
translated: 'This bowl is returned to you. You should not keep it, nor should you discriminate or give it to others. You should carefully consider and use it slowly, until it breaks, and then you should protect it. This is the proper way.'
If a bhikṣu means the group of six.
The rest of the meaning is as above.

original: 減五綴者，謂不滿五綴也。
analyzed: 減五綴者，謂不滿五綴也。
translated: Less than five mends means not more than five mends.
Capable of being used means that it can be kept.

original: 為好故更求餘鉢者，為欲貪好更求第二鉢，好謂勝妙也。
analyzed: 為好故更求餘鉢者，為欲貪好更求第二鉢，好謂勝妙也。
translated: In order to seek a better one, to seek another bowl means to seek a second bowl out of greed for a better one. Better means superior and wonderful.
To obtain means to obtain and take into one's possession.
Niḥsargikā pātayantikā means as explained above.
The bhikṣu means the one who has committed the offense.

original: 彼苾芻應於眾中捨此鉢者，當於眾中應差一苾芻令行有犯鉢。
analyzed: 彼苾芻應於眾中捨此鉢者，當於眾中應差一苾芻令行有犯鉢。
translated: That bhikṣu should give up this bowl in the assembly means that in the assembly he should appoint a bhikṣu to distribute the bowls that have been committed.

original: 若無五德，不應差，若差不應令作。
analyzed: 若無五德，不應差，若差不應令作。
translated: If he does not have the five virtues, he should not be appointed, and if he is appointed, he should not be allowed to do it.
What are the five?

original: 有愛、恚、怖、癡、不知行與不行。
analyzed: 有愛、恚、怖、癡、不知行與不行。
translated: There is love, hatred, fear, delusion, and not knowing what to do and what not to do.

original: 若具五德，未差應差、差已令作。
analyzed: 若具五德，未差應差、差已令作。
translated: If one possesses these five virtues, one who has not been appointed should be appointed, and one who has been appointed should be made to do it.
What are the five?
The opposite of the above should be known. One should be appointed like this.

original: 鳴揵稚集眾僧，先問能不？
analyzed: 鳴揵稚集眾僧，先問能不？
translated: Ring the gandi to assemble the saṃgha. First ask if one is able.

original: 「汝某甲能與僧伽行有犯鉢不？
analyzed: 「汝某甲能與僧伽行有犯鉢不？
translated: You so-and-so, are you able to carry out the saṃgha's defiled bowl?
He replies:
Able.

original: 」次一苾芻作白羯磨，如是應作廣如百一羯磨。
analyzed: 」次一苾芻作白羯磨，如是應作廣如百一羯磨。
translated: Next, a single bhikṣu makes the announcement and karman, like this. The details are like the Hundred and One Karmas.
The Buddha said:

original: 「行有犯鉢苾芻，所有行法我今說之。
analyzed: 「行有犯鉢苾芻，所有行法我今說之。
translated: The bhikṣu who carries out the defiled bowl, the rules for carrying out, I will now explain.

original: 其苾芻應在和合眾中作如是白：
analyzed: 其苾芻應在和合眾中作如是白：
translated: That bhikṣu should make this announcement in the harmonious assembly:
'Venerable sirs!

original: 我苾芻某甲當行有犯鉢。
analyzed: 我苾芻某甲當行有犯鉢。
translated: I, the bhikṣu so-and-so, will carry out the defiled bowl.
All the venerable ones!

original: 明日各各自持己鉢來至僧中。
analyzed: 明日各各自持己鉢來至僧中。
translated: Tomorrow each bring your own bowl to the saṃgha.

original: 』既至明日，行鉢苾芻敷座鳴揵稚，諸苾芻各持己鉢往至僧中。
analyzed: 』既至明日，行鉢苾芻敷座鳴揵稚，諸苾芻各持己鉢往至僧中。
translated: The next day, the monk distributing the bowls should set out seats and ring the gandi. The monks should each bring their own bowls and go to the Sangha.

original: 時行鉢苾芻應持其鉢，向上座前立讚歎其鉢：
analyzed: 時行鉢苾芻應持其鉢，向上座前立讚歎其鉢：
translated: Then the monk distributing the bowls should take the bowl and stand before the most senior monk, praising the bowl:
'Most senior monk!

original: 此鉢清淨圓滿堪得受用，若欲得者隨意應取。
analyzed: 此鉢清淨圓滿堪得受用，若欲得者隨意應取。
translated: This bowl is pure and complete, suitable for use. If you wish to obtain it, you may take it as you please.'

original: 』若其上座取此鉢者，行鉢之人應取上座舊鉢轉與第二。
analyzed: 』若其上座取此鉢者，行鉢之人應取上座舊鉢轉與第二。
translated: If the most senior monk takes this bowl, the monk distributing the bowls should take the most senior monk's old bowl and pass it to the second most senior monk.

original: 上座若不取者轉與第三，第三取時上座更索，初索不應與，第二索亦不應與，第三索應與，上座得越法罪，如法應悔。
analyzed: 上座若不取者轉與第三，第三取時上座更索，初索不應與，第二索亦不應與，第三索應與，上座得越法罪，如法應悔。
translated: If the most senior monk does not take it, it is passed to the third most senior monk. When the third most senior monk takes it, the most senior monk asks for it again. The first time he asks, it should not be given. The second time he asks, it should still not be given. The third time he asks, it should be given. The most senior monk commits a transgression of the rules and should repent in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 如是乃至大眾行末最小者，取此鉢時行末第三方索鉢者，其法與上座相似。
analyzed: 如是乃至大眾行末最小者，取此鉢時行末第三方索鉢者，其法與上座相似。
translated: In this way, it is distributed to the end of the assembly, to the youngest monk. When he takes this bowl, the youngest monk asks for the bowl a third time. The Dharma is similar to that of the most senior monk.

original: 乃至行了所得一鉢，行鉢苾芻應持此鉢，付彼苾芻作如是語：
analyzed: 乃至行了所得一鉢，行鉢苾芻應持此鉢，付彼苾芻作如是語：
translated: The monk who distributes the bowls should take this bowl and give it to that monk, saying:
'Monk!

original: 此鉢不應守持，不應分別亦不與人，詳審徐徐如法而用乃至破壞，此是其法。
analyzed: 此鉢不應守持，不應分別亦不與人，詳審徐徐如法而用乃至破壞，此是其法。
translated: You should not keep this bowl, nor should you discriminate against it or give it to others. Carefully and slowly use it according to the Dharma until it breaks. This is the proper procedure.'

original: 』若行鉢苾芻不依法行者，得越法罪。
analyzed: 』若行鉢苾芻不依法行者，得越法罪。
translated: If the monk who distributes the bowls does not act according to the rules, he commits a transgression.
The Buddha said:

original: 「得鉢苾芻所有行法我今當制，應畜二鉢帒。
analyzed: 「得鉢苾芻所有行法我今當制，應畜二鉢帒。
translated: I will now establish the rules for monks who have obtained bowls. They should keep two bowl bags.

original: 好者應安長鉢，不好者應安舊鉢。
analyzed: 好者應安長鉢，不好者應安舊鉢。
translated: The better one should be used for the long bowl, and the poorer one should be used for the old bowl.

original: 若乞食時應將二鉢，得乾餅者著長鉢中，若得濕餅著舊鉢中。
analyzed: 若乞食時應將二鉢，得乾餅者著長鉢中，若得濕餅著舊鉢中。
translated: When begging for food, they should take two bowls. If they get dry cakes, they should put them in the long bowl. If they get wet cakes, they should put them in the old bowl.

original: 至住處已作曼荼羅安置二鉢，應於舊鉢中食已，應先洗長鉢次洗舊鉢，如是乃至曬曝安置皆以長鉢為先。
analyzed: 至住處已作曼荼羅安置二鉢，應於舊鉢中食已，應先洗長鉢次洗舊鉢，如是乃至曬曝安置皆以長鉢為先。
translated: Having arrived at the dwelling place, he should make a maṇḍala and place the two bowls. He should eat from the old bowl first, and then wash the new bowl and the old bowl. In this way, even when drying and storing them, he should prioritize the new bowl.

original: 若內安龕及火熏時，皆於好處先安長鉢。
analyzed: 若內安龕及火熏時，皆於好處先安長鉢。
translated: If he is putting them away in a cabinet or fumigating them with fire, he should first put the new bowl in a good place.

original: 若道行時，舊鉢遣人持，長鉢當自持。
analyzed: 若道行時，舊鉢遣人持，長鉢當自持。
translated: If he is traveling, he should have someone else carry the old bowl, and he himself should carry the new bowl.

original: 無人為擎者，長鉢安在左肩，舊鉢應安右畔自持而去。
analyzed: 無人為擎者，長鉢安在左肩，舊鉢應安右畔自持而去。
translated: If there is no one to carry it for him, he should place the new bowl on his left shoulder, and the old bowl he should place on the right side and carry it himself.

original: 若得鉢苾芻，於此行法不依行者，得越法罪。
analyzed: 若得鉢苾芻，於此行法不依行者，得越法罪。
translated: If a bhikṣu who has obtained a bowl does not follow these rules of conduct, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 此之治罰乃至盡形或至破來，應好守護。
analyzed: 此之治罰乃至盡形或至破來，應好守護。
translated: This punishment lasts until the end of his life or until the bowl is broken. He should protect it well.
Obtains a niḥsargika-pātayantika offense is explained in detail above.
What are the circumstances of the offense in this case?

original: 若苾芻鉢破堪為一綴，雖未安綴尚得受用，更求餘鉢者，求時犯惡作、得便捨墮。
analyzed: 若苾芻鉢破堪為一綴，雖未安綴尚得受用，更求餘鉢者，求時犯惡作、得便捨墮。
translated: If a bhikṣu's alms bowl has a crack that can be repaired with one patch, and although it has not yet been repaired he is still able to use it, and he seeks another bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in seeking, and upon obtaining it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 若苾芻鉢破堪為二綴，雖未安綴尚得受用，更求餘鉢，得罪同前。
analyzed: 若苾芻鉢破堪為二綴，雖未安綴尚得受用，更求餘鉢，得罪同前。
translated: If a bhikṣu's alms bowl has a crack that can be repaired with two patches, and although it has not yet been repaired he is still able to use it, and he seeks another bowl, he commits the same offense as before.

original: 如是三綴四綴，事亦如前。
analyzed: 如是三綴四綴，事亦如前。
translated: The same applies to three or four patches.

original: 苾芻鉢破堪為一綴，安一綴已現得受用，更求餘鉢，求時惡作、得便捨墮。
analyzed: 苾芻鉢破堪為一綴，安一綴已現得受用，更求餘鉢，求時惡作、得便捨墮。
translated: If a bhikṣu's alms bowl has a crack that can be repaired with one patch, and after repairing it with one patch he is still able to use it, and he seeks another bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in seeking, and upon obtaining it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 如是乃至四綴，得罪亦爾。
analyzed: 如是乃至四綴，得罪亦爾。
translated: The same applies to up to four patches.

original: 若鉢堪為五綴，隨綴不綴、或堪用不堪用，更求餘鉢者無犯。
analyzed: 若鉢堪為五綴，隨綴不綴、或堪用不堪用，更求餘鉢者無犯。
translated: If a bhikṣu's alms bowl can be repaired with five patches, whether it is repaired or not, whether it is usable or not, if he seeks another bowl, there is no offense.

original: 若買得、或施得，此亦無犯。
analyzed: 若買得、或施得，此亦無犯。
translated: If he buys it or receives it as a gift, there is also no offense.

original: 又無犯者，最初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。
analyzed: 又無犯者，最初犯人，或癡狂、心亂、痛惱所纏。
translated: There is no offense for the first offense, or if he is insane, mentally disturbed, or in pain.

original: 23 自乞縷使非親族織師織作衣學處自乞縷使非親族織師織作衣學處第二十三佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
analyzed: 23 自乞縷使非親族織師織作衣學處自乞縷使非親族織師織作衣學處第二十三佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
translated: The Buddha was at Jetavana Anāthapiṇḍada-ārāma near Śrāvastī.
At that time, Upananda thought:

original: 「皆由給孤獨長者制諸學處，更欲勸化餅果之直亦不能得。
analyzed: 「皆由給孤獨長者制諸學處，更欲勸化餅果之直亦不能得。
translated: It is all because of Anāthapiṇḍada that the training rules were established. If I want to collect donations for pastries and fruits again, I will not be able to do so.

original: 我今宜可入大城中，或容教化少有所得。
analyzed: 我今宜可入大城中，或容教化少有所得。
translated: I should now enter the great city, and perhaps I will be able to collect a little.

original: 」即於晨朝著衣持鉢入城乞食，於芳林處有五百女人撚白疊線，見已便念：
analyzed: 」即於晨朝著衣持鉢入城乞食，於芳林處有五百女人撚白疊線，見已便念：
translated: In the morning, he put on his robes, took his bowl, and entered the city to beg for food. In a fragrant grove, there were five hundred women spinning white woolen thread. Seeing this, he thought:

original: 「斯等女人皆由自業，無問晝夜常執白犁，辛苦勞勤輸官課稅。
analyzed: 「斯等女人皆由自業，無問晝夜常執白犁，辛苦勞勤輸官課稅。
translated: These women are all due to their own karma. Whether day or night, they always hold white plows, suffering hardship and hard work, paying taxes to the government.

original: 」鄔波難陀即便就彼總告之曰：
analyzed: 」鄔波難陀即便就彼總告之曰：
translated: Upananda then went to them and said in general:
Sisters!
May you all attain long life without illness.
At that time, the woman remained silent and did not respond at all.
Upananda said:
Sisters!

original: 當有一法不久來至，是眾多人所不愛樂，咸不稱心，名之為死。
analyzed: 當有一法不久來至，是眾多人所不愛樂，咸不稱心，名之為死。
translated: There is one dharma that will come soon, which is not loved by many people, and is not to everyone's liking, and that is called death.

original: 當爾之時汝雖欲語求說無由。
analyzed: 當爾之時汝雖欲語求說無由。
translated: At that time, even if you want to speak, there will be no way to do so.

original: 」時有白色女人，即從座起以座授與鄔波難陀。
analyzed: 」時有白色女人，即從座起以座授與鄔波難陀。
translated: At that time, a white-colored woman rose from her seat and offered it to Upananda.

original: 時鄔波難陀就座坐已，女便禮拜當前而坐，鄔波難陀告曰：
analyzed: 時鄔波難陀就座坐已，女便禮拜當前而坐，鄔波難陀告曰：
translated: When Upananda sat down on the seat, the woman then paid homage and sat in front of him. Upananda said:
Sisters!
Have you ever cultivated any good deeds?
She replied:
I have never done so.
He said:
You should not fail to do good deeds.

original: 此一女人具於二種善根令得增長：
analyzed: 此一女人具於二種善根令得增長：
translated: This one woman possesses two kinds of wholesome roots that cause her to attain growth:

original: 一、能於我所生淨信心殖端正業令得增長；
analyzed: 一、能於我所生淨信心殖端正業令得增長；
translated: One, she is able to give rise to pure faith in me, and to plant the deed of being upright, causing it to grow;

original: 二、見我來便起設座禮拜恭敬，於當來世生貴族業令得增長。
analyzed: 二、見我來便起設座禮拜恭敬，於當來世生貴族業令得增長。
translated: Second, if they see me coming, they immediately stand up, set out a seat, pay homage respectfully, and in the future will be born into a noble family, causing their good deeds to increase.

original: 若更能施少許物者，當獲珍財受用豐足。
analyzed: 若更能施少許物者，當獲珍財受用豐足。
translated: If they can give a little bit more, they will obtain precious wealth and enjoy abundance.
What are you all doing, sisters?
They all replied:

original: 「我等但知撚線而已，何暇作餘？
analyzed: 「我等但知撚線而已，何暇作餘？
translated: We only know how to spin thread, how could we have time to do anything else?
Upananda said:

original: 「汝等頗曾少作當來道路糧不？
analyzed: 「汝等頗曾少作當來道路糧不？
translated: Have you ever made any provisions for the road ahead?
They answered:
We have never made any.
Upananda said:
That is also not good.
They then asked:
Noble one!
What do you praise?
He replied:
Sisters!

original: 汝於先世不修福業，被賊劫來今受辛苦。
analyzed: 汝於先世不修福業，被賊劫來今受辛苦。
translated: In your past lives, you did not cultivate meritorious deeds, so you were captured by thieves and now suffer hardship.

original: 雖得為人更不修福被賊劫去。
analyzed: 雖得為人更不修福被賊劫去。
translated: Although you have become human again, you do not cultivate merit again and are captured by thieves.
The women asked:
If that's the case, noble one,

original: 我等今時欲作何業，能使遠作當來路糧？
analyzed: 我等今時欲作何業，能使遠作當來路糧？
translated: what work can we do now to prepare provisions for the road in the future?
Upananda said:
Sisters,

original: 汝等若能眾議同心造一大疊，奉釋種內棄俗出家、三藏俱閑是大法將、辯才無滯眾共知者，斯即是汝預作來世道路資糧。
analyzed: 汝等若能眾議同心造一大疊，奉釋種內棄俗出家、三藏俱閑是大法將、辯才無滯眾共知者，斯即是汝預作來世道路資糧。
translated: if you can all agree to make a large piece of cloth and offer it to the one who has renounced the householder life from the Śākya clan, who is well-versed in the Tripiṭaka and is a great Dharma teacher, whose eloquence is unimpeded and is known to the assembly, this will be your preparation of provisions for the road in the future.
The women replied:
Noble one,
where can we get a large piece of cloth?

original: 復於何處逢遇如是勝上福田？
analyzed: 復於何處逢遇如是勝上福田？
translated: And where can we encounter such a supreme field of merit?
Upananda said:
Don't you know?

original: 我是釋種棄俗出家、三藏俱閑為大法將、辯才無滯眾所識知。
analyzed: 我是釋種棄俗出家、三藏俱閑為大法將、辯才無滯眾所識知。
translated: I am the one who has renounced the householder life from the Śākya clan, who is well-versed in the Tripiṭaka and is a great Dharma teacher, whose eloquence is unimpeded and is known to the assembly.
You said:
'Where can we get a large piece of cloth?'
Don't you know?
Do not look down on small acts of giving as having no merit;
Although a drop of water is small, it can eventually fill a large vessel.

original: 諸有智者，　　小福常修；
analyzed: 諸有智者，　　小福常修；
translated: All the wise ones always cultivate small merits;

original: 於勝田中，　　能招大果。
analyzed: 於勝田中，　　能招大果。
translated: In the superior field, they can reap great fruits.
Sisters!
Can you not give one or two strands of thread?
They replied:
We can.
Some said:
I will give half a strand.
Some said:
I will give one-third.

original: 」如是乃至盡五百人咸隨喜捨。
analyzed: 」如是乃至盡五百人咸隨喜捨。
translated: In this way, all five hundred people joyfully gave their consent.
Upananda said:
Sisters!
Since you have the intention to give, the thread must be fine.
They said:
Noble one!

original: 我等皆是撚麁縷人，不能精細，然有一女能作細縷。
analyzed: 我等皆是撚麁縷人，不能精細，然有一女能作細縷。
translated: We are all people who spin coarse thread, and cannot do fine thread, but there is one woman who can make fine thread.
Upananda said:
Try to call her to come and see.
They immediately called her to come.
Upananda said:
Girl, you try to spin it.
She then spun it.
Upananda said:
This is not yet good, spin it better.
This went on up to three times.
The woman said:
Noble one!
Beyond this, I am unable.
Upananda said:
Sister!
You should all spin it this finely.
She replied:
Except for this girl, we are unable.
Upananda said:

original: 「汝豈不能換其作業，此為撚細，汝為撚麁。
analyzed: 「汝豈不能換其作業，此為撚細，汝為撚麁。
translated: Can you not switch tasks? She spins it fine, you spin it coarse.
She said:
If this girl agrees, we will do as she says.
Upananda said to the girl:
If you wish for blessings, you can spin it.
She then replied:
Noble one!

original: 若撚細縷多時方辦，幸勿疾催。
analyzed: 若撚細縷多時方辦，幸勿疾催。
translated: If it takes a long time to spin the fine thread, please don't urge me too quickly.

original: 」鄔波難陀見其許已呪願而去。
analyzed: 」鄔波難陀見其許已呪願而去。
translated: When Upananda saw that they had agreed, he gave them his blessings and left.

original: 既經多日便來問縷，諸女悉皆持縷相施。
analyzed: 既經多日便來問縷，諸女悉皆持縷相施。
translated: After many days had passed, he came to ask about the thread. The women all offered him thread.

original: 鄔波難陀既受得縷皆與呪願：
analyzed: 鄔波難陀既受得縷皆與呪願：
translated: After Upananda had received the thread, he gave them all his blessings, saying:

original: 「此之施物是莊嚴心，是心資助勝定資糧，當獲人天上妙衣服。
analyzed: 「此之施物是莊嚴心，是心資助勝定資糧，當獲人天上妙衣服。
translated: This offering is an adornment of the mind, a support for the mind's provisions for superior concentration, and will result in obtaining wonderful clothing in the human and heavenly realms.

original: 」時鄔波難陀即持其縷還詣寺中，告諸苾芻曰：
analyzed: 」時鄔波難陀即持其縷還詣寺中，告諸苾芻曰：
translated: At that time, Upananda took the thread and returned to the monastery, telling the monks:
Venerable ones!
Try to see how coarse or fine this thread is.
They all replied:

original: 「極妙細縷，然不知大德頗別好織師不？
analyzed: 「極妙細縷，然不知大德頗別好織師不？
translated: It is extremely fine thread, but we don't know if the Venerable has found any good weavers.
Upananda said:
Are you not deceiving me, sirs?

original: 我若向者不出家者，一切伎巧無不精研，何況織師而不識別。
analyzed: 我若向者不出家者，一切伎巧無不精研，何況織師而不識別。
translated: If I had not gone forth at that time, I would have been proficient in all crafts and skills, let alone weaving.
The people replied:
How dare we belittle you, but we were afraid you might not know the place.

original: 若須織師者於某坊中有㒓額織師，并有巧婦善能織疊，若得此縷必成好衣。
analyzed: 若須織師者於某坊中有㒓額織師，并有巧婦善能織疊，若得此縷必成好衣。
translated: If you need a weaver, there is a weaver named Blank in such-and-such ward, and he has a skilled wife who is good at weaving cloth. If you get her thread, you will surely get a good robe.
He said:🔽Excellent!
Venerable!

original: 教處好匠者，此即是仁為我織疊。
analyzed: 教處好匠者，此即是仁為我織疊。
translated: Teaching me to find a good craftsman is just like you weaving a robe for me.

original: 」鄔波難陀遂持其縷詣織師處，素非親友而說頌曰：
analyzed: 」鄔波難陀遂持其縷詣織師處，素非親友而說頌曰：
translated: Upananda then took the thread to the weaver's place. Although they were not close friends, he spoke a verse, saying:🔽The good person's beautiful reputation,

original: 「善人騰美譽，　　雖遠悉知聞；
analyzed: 「善人騰美譽，　　雖遠悉知聞；
translated: Though far away, is heard by all;🔽Just like the great snow mountain king,

original: 如大雪山王，　　人皆共瞻仰。
analyzed: 如大雪山王，　　人皆共瞻仰。
translated: All people look up to him.🔽The fool guards his foolishness and delusion,

original: 愚者守癡惑，　　雖近不知聞；
analyzed: 愚者守癡惑，　　雖近不知聞；
translated: Though near, he does not know or hear;🔽Just like shooting an arrow in the dark,

original: 如闇射箭時，　　人皆不能見。
analyzed: 如闇射箭時，　　人皆不能見。
translated: People cannot see it at all.

original: 「汝今得大利益獲大名稱遍室羅伐城，試為看此縷線其狀何如？
analyzed: 「汝今得大利益獲大名稱遍室羅伐城，試為看此縷線其狀何如？
translated: You have now gained great benefits and obtained great fame spreading throughout Śrāvastī. Try to see what this thread looks like.
He looked and reported:
It's a very good thread!
If I weave it, it will make a fine cloth.
Upananda said:
Wise one!
Weave it.
The weaver said:
Who will pay me?
Upananda said:

original: 「汝諸織師價常不足，於未來世應作資糧。
analyzed: 「汝諸織師價常不足，於未來世應作資糧。
translated: You weavers are always short of wages, in the future you should make provisions.

original: 」時彼織師迴觀婦面，婦便告曰：
analyzed: 」時彼織師迴觀婦面，婦便告曰：
translated: Then the weaver looked back at his wife, and she said:

original: 「仁豈不聞此之大德深相讚歎，可宜施手為織疊衣。
analyzed: 「仁豈不聞此之大德深相讚歎，可宜施手為織疊衣。
translated: Have you not heard that this great virtue praises you deeply? You should lend a hand and weave the cloth.
The weaver said:
Noble one!

original: 此縷極細多時方得，幸勿相催。
analyzed: 此縷極細多時方得，幸勿相催。
translated: This thread is very fine and takes a long time to get, please don't rush me.
He then made a wish and left.

original: 既經多日方重來看，是時織師授與其疊。
analyzed: 既經多日方重來看，是時織師授與其疊。
translated: After many days, he went to see him again, and at that time the weaver gave him the cloth.

original: 時鄔波難陀受得疊已呪願而去，還至寺中示諸苾芻曰：
analyzed: 時鄔波難陀受得疊已呪願而去，還至寺中示諸苾芻曰：
translated: At that time, Upananda received the cloth, made a benediction, and left. He returned to the monastery and showed it to the monks, saying:
Venerable ones!
Look at this cloth, what is its appearance like?
The others said:
This is a very good white cloth!

original: 若其更得第二張者，刺作兩重僧伽胝服，省事而住修諸善品，誠亦善哉。
analyzed: 若其更得第二張者，刺作兩重僧伽胝服，省事而住修諸善品，誠亦善哉。
translated: If we could get a second piece, we could sew it into a double-layered saṃghāṭī robe, and living simply and cultivating wholesome practices would truly be excellent.
Upananda said:
Venerable ones!

original: 仁等謂我無力能得第二張耶？
analyzed: 仁等謂我無力能得第二張耶？
translated: Do you think I am incapable of obtaining a second piece?

original: 仁等試看，我今如何教化其疊。
analyzed: 仁等試看，我今如何教化其疊。
translated: Look, how am I going to convert the cloth?

original: 」晨朝著衣持鉢便於別門入室羅伐城，從他覓縷至㒓額織師所，廣說如前以縷相示。
analyzed: 」晨朝著衣持鉢便於別門入室羅伐城，從他覓縷至㒓額織師所，廣說如前以縷相示。
translated: In the morning, he put on his robes, took his bowl, and entered Śrāvastī through another gate. He sought thread from others and went to the weaver's place, explaining in detail as before and showing him the thread.
He said:
Good thread!
If I weave, I will make a fine upper cloth.
If that's the case, then weave.
She replied:
Who will pay the price?
He said:

original: 「汝之織師不解修福，於當來世貧窮未休，應可更為資糧之業。
analyzed: 「汝之織師不解修福，於當來世貧窮未休，應可更為資糧之業。
translated: Your weaver does not know how to cultivate merit, and in the future he will not be free from poverty. You should create more karma for provisions.
She said:
Noble one!

original: 前為織衣，噉他飲食，比來還債猶未能了；
analyzed: 前為織衣，噉他飲食，比來還債猶未能了；
translated: Previously, for weaving clothes, I ate other people's food, and now in return I still haven't been able to repay the debt;
Now, if I weave again for no reason, what will I do?
Upananda looked at the woman's face, and the husband said:
Noble one!
Even if my wife wants to, I really can't.
Upananda angrily said:

original: 「汝㒓額織師，我今指汝禿頂為誓，若我不能使汝織者，我不復名鄔波難陀矣！
analyzed: 「汝㒓額織師，我今指汝禿頂為誓，若我不能使汝織者，我不復名鄔波難陀矣！
translated: You bald-headed weaver, I now point to you and swear, if I cannot make you weave, then I will no longer be called Upananda!
Then the weaver angrily said:

original: 「汝禿沙門，我指為誓，我必不能與汝織疊。
analyzed: 「汝禿沙門，我指為誓，我必不能與汝織疊。
translated: You shaven-headed monk, I swear with my fingers that I absolutely cannot give you a woven cloth.

original: 」鄔波難陀即便瞋怒思量而去。
analyzed: 」鄔波難陀即便瞋怒思量而去。
translated: Upananda then left in anger.

original: 時憍薩羅勝光大王有得意臣名曰賢善，與鄔波難陀是舊知識，遂行詣彼既至門所，而問之曰：
analyzed: 時憍薩羅勝光大王有得意臣名曰賢善，與鄔波難陀是舊知識，遂行詣彼既至門所，而問之曰：
translated: At that time, King Prasenajit of Kośala had a trusted minister named Bhadra, who was an old acquaintance of Upananda. He went to his door and asked:
Is Bhadra here?
He replied:
He went to the market.

original: 」時鄔波難陀即便就市覓之，是時賢善在沽酒家。
analyzed: 」時鄔波難陀即便就市覓之，是時賢善在沽酒家。
translated: At that time, Bhadra was at a wine shop.

original: 鄔波難陀至其門所，遣信入喚為報賢善：
analyzed: 鄔波難陀至其門所，遣信入喚為報賢善：
translated: Upananda went to his door and sent a message to call him, saying to Bhadra:

original: 「鄔波難陀要欲相見，可暫出來。
analyzed: 「鄔波難陀要欲相見，可暫出來。
translated: Upananda wants to see you, please come out for a moment.

original: 」使者報知，賢善尋出即便合掌云：
analyzed: 」使者報知，賢善尋出即便合掌云：
translated: The messenger reported this, and Bhadra came out and immediately joined his palms and said:
I pay homage to the Venerable Upananda.
At that time, Upananda said:
Bhadra!
and live a long life without illness.

original: 我比謂汝常勤公事，寧知閑隙得在酒家。
analyzed: 我比謂汝常勤公事，寧知閑隙得在酒家。
translated: I thought you were always busy with official duties, how could I have known you would be in a wine shop in your spare time?
He replied:
Venerable!

original: 我因公事來至於此，大德何緣至此相覓？
analyzed: 我因公事來至於此，大德何緣至此相覓？
translated: I came here because of official business. Why did the Venerable come here to look for me?
He replied:

original: 「我有少縷可為織衣，仁當獲福。
analyzed: 「我有少縷可為織衣，仁當獲福。
translated: I have some thread that can be woven into robes. You will obtain blessings.
He replied:
I will offer the cloth. Why bother weaving?
Upananda said:

original: 「斯誠善事，然我此縷是信心物，豈虛棄耶？
analyzed: 「斯誠善事，然我此縷是信心物，豈虛棄耶？
translated: This is indeed a good thing, but this thread of mine is a faithful offering. How can I waste it?
Then he ordered a messenger, saying:

original: 「汝去語當織人，汝等可為大德鄔波難陀織好白疊。
analyzed: 「汝去語當織人，汝等可為大德鄔波難陀織好白疊。
translated: Go and tell the weavers, 'You should weave a fine white cloth for the Venerable Upananda.'
Upananda said:
Wise one!
This is also unnecessary to tell the weavers.

original: 然於某坊有一㒓額織師，并有巧婦可令彼織。
analyzed: 然於某坊有一㒓額織師，并有巧婦可令彼織。
translated: However, in a certain ward there is a weaver named Blank and a skilled wife who can weave it for you.
Then the wise and good one ordered a messenger:
You should now go to the weaver Blank's place and tell him:
'The wise and good one orders you to weave this robe.'
At that time, the messenger took the thread to him and said:

original: 「大臣賢善遣將此縷，可為織衣。
analyzed: 「大臣賢善遣將此縷，可為織衣。
translated: The minister Wise and Good sent this thread, please weave it into a robe.

original: 」織師見縷訖即便憶識，報使者言：
analyzed: 」織師見縷訖即便憶識，報使者言：
translated: The weaver saw the thread and immediately remembered, and said to the messenger:
My turn has already been woven.

original: 」時彼使人持縷還去，至賢善所具說所由。
analyzed: 」時彼使人持縷還去，至賢善所具說所由。
translated: Then the messenger took the thread back and went to the wise and good one to explain the reason.
The wise and good one said:
You go and tell him:
'Now weave this robe, and let the next turn go.'

original: 』」使者便去以語報知，織師答曰：
analyzed: 』」使者便去以語報知，織師答曰：
translated: The messenger then went and reported it, and the weaver replied:

original: 「大臣賢善於城中秉權有力，我寧移去不住於此，誰能越次為織作耶？
analyzed: 「大臣賢善於城中秉權有力，我寧移去不住於此，誰能越次為織作耶？
translated: The minister is wise and has power in the city. I would rather move away and not stay here. Who can skip the turn to weave?

original: 」使者還去，具以其語報賢善知。
analyzed: 」使者還去，具以其語報賢善知。
translated: The messenger returned and reported this to the wise one.
The wise one then again told the messenger:

original: 「汝可還語當織之人，令依番次為織此疊。
analyzed: 「汝可還語當織之人，令依番次為織此疊。
translated: You should go back and tell the weaver to weave the cloth according to the turn.
Upananda heard this and said:
Others cannot, only the one with a forehead can.
The wise one again ordered the messenger:
You should go to the one with a forehead and tell him:
'Weave it, I will give you the price.'

original: 』」使者便往，鄔波難陀亦即隨出，告使者曰：
analyzed: 』」使者便往，鄔波難陀亦即隨出，告使者曰：
translated: The messenger went, and Upananda also immediately went out and told the messenger:
Foolish person!

original: 誰復令汝承事王臣，汝合多與杖木令擔柴立，豈容為片作務頻遣賢善勞心？
analyzed: 誰復令汝承事王臣，汝合多與杖木令擔柴立，豈容為片作務頻遣賢善勞心？
translated: Who else would let you serve the king's ministers? You should give him many sticks to carry firewood. How can you let a small task frequently trouble the wise one?

original: 汝豈不能至織師所作如是說：
analyzed: 汝豈不能至織師所作如是說：
translated: Can you not go to the weaver and say this:
'Virtuous one, send this white cloth to be woven.'
If he says:
I cannot.
Then grab his hair with your hand, make a fist, and hit his spine.

original: 若叫喚者，卷其織具勿令執作。
analyzed: 若叫喚者，卷其織具勿令執作。
translated: If he cries out, roll up his weaving equipment and do not let him work.

original: 若其婦女來唱喚時，急曳頭髻牽使出門，而告之曰：
analyzed: 若其婦女來唱喚時，急曳頭髻牽使出門，而告之曰：
translated: If his wife comes and shouts, quickly pull his hair and drag him out the door, and tell him:

original: 『汝今違拒賢善教令，勝光大王必當罰汝五百金錢。
analyzed: 『汝今違拒賢善教令，勝光大王必當罰汝五百金錢。
translated: You now disobey the virtuous one's instructions. King Prasenajit will surely fine you five hundred gold coins.
Say:
Foolish man!

original: 汝若能得織成此衣者，彼多與汝辛苦之直，何須還往空置劬勞？
analyzed: 汝若能得織成此衣者，彼多與汝辛苦之直，何須還往空置劬勞？
translated: If you can weave this cloth, he will give you much hard-earned money. Why bother going back to waste your efforts?
Then the messenger returned to the weaver and said:
The virtuous one said this:
'You should weave it, and I will pay you.'
The weaver replied:🔽What?
I cannot weave this cloth out of order.

original: 」使者以手撮髮拳打脊梁，彼即大叫便卷織機，其婦唱喚遂捉其髮曳之而去，報言：
analyzed: 」使者以手撮髮拳打脊梁，彼即大叫便卷織機，其婦唱喚遂捉其髮曳之而去，報言：
translated: The messenger grabbed his hair with his hand, punched his spine, and he immediately cried out and rolled up the loom. His wife cried out and grabbed his hair, dragging him away, saying:

original: 「汝等違拒大臣教命，勝光大王必當罰汝五百金錢。
analyzed: 「汝等違拒大臣教命，勝光大王必當罰汝五百金錢。
translated: You disobeyed the great minister's orders. King Prasenajit will surely fine you five hundred gold coins.

original: 」婦聞是已便大驚怖，告其夫曰：
analyzed: 」婦聞是已便大驚怖，告其夫曰：
translated: When his wife heard this, she was greatly frightened and said to her husband:

original: 「我等繫獄誰當救濟，必嬰枷鎖而取終亡，我今宜可織此大疊。
analyzed: 「我等繫獄誰當救濟，必嬰枷鎖而取終亡，我今宜可織此大疊。
translated: If we are imprisoned, who will save us? We will surely die in chains. We should now weave this large cloth.
The weaver then told the messenger:
Don't take me to the judge.
